sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"变成，成为"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: become, get, grow, turn, go, come
means: become ： 最普通用词，作为连系动词，指从一个状态向另一个状态的变化。
get ： 常指某人或某物有意无意地获得引起变化的因素，结果使变成另一状态。
grow ： 常指逐渐地变成新状态，强调渐变的过程。
turn ： 侧重指变得与原来截然不同，有时含贬义。
go ： 作为连系动词，通常与形容词连用，指进入某种状态，从而发生变化，多指不好的状态。
come ： 侧重变化的经过或过程，多用于不良情况。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"到达"之意。
means: come ： 普通用词，含义广泛。强调到达的动作或进程，不侧重是否到达目的地。也可用于比喻意义。
arrive ： 侧重到达目的地或达到某一目标。也可用作比喻。
reach ： 既可指到达目的地，又可指到达途中的中间站。强调经过的周折或付出的努力。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 东山再起：在一段不幸之后回到或再获得过去的成功

lj.lj_ly: came back with a sharp riposte.
lj.lj_ls: 以尖锐的反驳回答

lj.lj_ly: When I saw the picture, happy memories came back.
lj.lj_ls: 当我看到这照片，美好的回忆又再度浮现

lj.lj_ly: Mortgages are hard to come by.
lj.lj_ls: 抵押难以获得

lj.lj_ly: He has really come down in the world.
lj.lj_ls: 他在这个世界上真的失去了地位

jx.jx_en_mean: To pass or be handed down by tradition
jx.jx_cn_mean: 宣判：从更高权威传下来

lj.lj_ly: customs that come down from colonial times.
lj.lj_ls: 从殖民时代传承下来的惯例

lj.lj_ly: An indictment finally came down.
lj.lj_ls: 终于宣判起诉

lj.lj_ly: What's coming down tonight?
lj.lj_ls: 今晚发生了什么事情?

lj.lj_ly: Fall clothes will be coming in soon.
lj.lj_ls: 秋装即将上市

lj.lj_ly: New weather information just came in.
lj.lj_ls: 新气象信息刚被采用

jx.jx_en_mean: To arrive among those who finish a contest or race
jx.jx_cn_mean: 比赛名次：在完成比赛的那些人中达到

lj.lj_ly: came in fifth.
lj.lj_ls: 第五名

jx.jx_en_mean: To perform or function in a particular way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 按特殊方法执行或运作

lj.lj_ly: A food processor comes in handy.
lj.lj_ls: 食品加工处理机用来十分便利

jx.jx_en_mean: To reply in a specified manner to a call or signal
jx.jx_cn_mean: 以特定方式回应：对电话或信号按特定方式回答

lj.lj_ly: The pilot's voice came in loud and clear.
lj.lj_ls: 飞行员回应的声音大而清晰

jx.jx_en_mean: To take on a specified role

lj.lj_ly: When editorial review commences, that's where you come in.
lj.lj_ls: 编辑复审开始时，那有你要做的工作

jx.jx_en_mean: To acquire, especially as an inheritance

lj.lj_ly: She came into a fortune on her 21st birthday.
lj.lj_ls: 她在二十一岁生日的时获得了一笔遗产

lj.lj_ly: The trip came off on schedule.
lj.lj_ls: 旅行按计划得到实现

lj.lj_ly: She is sure to come off badly if challenged to explain.
lj.lj_ls: 如果被要求解释，她肯定表现得很差

jx.jx_en_mean: To turn out to be successful

lj.lj_ly: a party that came off.
lj.lj_ls: 成功的晚会

jx.jx_en_mean: To convey a particular personal image

lj.lj_ly: comes on as an old-fashioned reactionary.
lj.lj_ls: 表现出象保守主义者

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Slang} To show sexual interest in someone

lj.lj_ly: trying to come on to me during the party.
lj.lj_ls: 在宴会期间力图亲近我

jx.jx_en_mean: To progress or advance in increments
jx.jx_cn_mean: 逐渐开始：按小的增额或程度开始

lj.lj_ly: Darkness came on after seven.
lj.lj_ls: 七点以后天色渐暗

lj.lj_ly: Sleet came on after one o'clock.
lj.lj_ls: 在一点钟后冰雹到来了

jx.jx_en_mean: To hurry up; move rapidly. Often used in the imperative
jx.jx_cn_mean: 催促；快速运动。常用于祈使语气

lj.lj_ly: Would you please come on! We'll be late!
lj.lj_ls: 请快一点吧！我们要晚了！

jx.jx_en_mean: To stop an inappropriate behavior; abandon a position or an attitude; be obliging. Used chiefly in the imperative
jx.jx_cn_mean: 制止：制止一种不合适的行为；放弃一种职位或态度；强迫。主要用于祈使语气

lj.lj_ly: You've used the same feeble excuse for weeks. Come on!
lj.lj_ls: 几个星期以来你一直采用相同的无力借口。别再装了

lj.lj_ly: The whole story came out at the trial.
lj.lj_ls: 整个真相在审问中变得众所周知

jx.jx_en_mean: To be issued or brought out

lj.lj_ly: The author's new book just came out.
lj.lj_ls: 作家的新书刚出版

jx.jx_en_mean: To make a formal social debut

lj.lj_ly: She came out at age 18 in New York City.
lj.lj_ls: 她于十八岁在纽约城初入社交圈

lj.lj_ly: Everything came out wrong.
lj.lj_ls: 每件事都是错误地结束

lj.lj_ly: The governor came out in favor of tax breaks.
lj.lj_ls: 这位政府官员公开宣布赞成停止征税

jx.jx_en_mean: To reveal that one is gay or homosexual.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 揭露某人同性恋的身份

jx.jx_en_mean: To change sides, as in a controversy.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 改变立场，例如在争论中

entry.def: When a person or thing comes to a particular place, especially to a place where you are, they move there.

example.ex: Two police officers came into the hall...
example.tran: 两位警官走进大厅。

example.ex: Come here, Tom...
example.tran: 汤姆，到这儿来。

entry.def: When someone comes to do something, they move to the place where someone else is in order to do it, and they do it. In British English, someone can also come and do something and in American English, someone can come do something. However, you always say that someone came and did something.
entry.tran: 来(做某事)(除了用 come to do something 表达此意，英国英语中也用 come and do something，美国英语中也用 come do something，但表示过去动作时一定要用 came and did something)

example.ex: Eleanor had come to visit her...
example.tran: 埃莉诺来看过她了。

example.ex: Come and meet Roger...
example.tran: 过来认识一下罗杰。

entry.def: When you come to a place, you reach it.

example.ex: He came to a door that led into a passageway.
example.tran: 他来到一扇门前，这扇门通往一条走廊。

entry.def: If something comes up to a particular point or down to it, it is tall enough, deep enough, or long enough to reach that point.

example.ex: The water came up to my chest...
example.tran: 水淹到了我的胸部。

example.ex: I wore a large shirt of Jamie's which came down over my hips.
example.tran: 我穿着杰米的衬衫，衬衫很大，把我的臀部都盖住了。

entry.def: If something comes apart or comes to pieces, it breaks into pieces. If something comes off or comes away, it becomes detached from something else.

example.ex: The pistol came to pieces, easily and quickly...
example.tran: 手枪很快就被拆得七零八落。

example.ex: The door knobs came off in our hands.
example.tran: 我们用手一扭，门把手就掉了下来。

entry.def: You use come in expressions such as come to an end or come into operation to indicate that someone or something enters or reaches a particular state or situation.
entry.tran: 达到，进入(某种状态或境地)

example.ex: The summer came to an end...
example.tran: 夏天结束了。

example.ex: The Communists came to power in 1944...
example.tran: 1944年共产党开始执政。

entry.def: If someone comes to do something, they do it at the end of a long process or period of time.
entry.tran: (经历漫长的过程或时间后)开始(做某事)

example.ex: She said it so many times that she came to believe it...
example.tran: 这件事她说了太多遍，以至自己都开始相信了。

example.ex: Although it was a secret wedding, the press did eventually come to hear about it.
example.tran: 尽管是场秘密的婚礼，媒体最终还是听到了消息。

entry.def: You can ask how something came to happen when you want to know what caused it to happen or made it possible.

example.ex: How did you come to meet him?
example.tran: 你是怎么碰到他的？

entry.def: When a particular event or time comes, it arrives or happens.

example.ex: The announcement came after a meeting at the Home Office...
example.tran: 内政部会议结束后，声明随即发表。

example.ex: The time has come for us to move on...
example.tran: 我们是时候继续前行了。

entry.def: You can use come before a date, time, or event to mean when that date, time, or event arrives. For example, you can say come the spring to mean 'when the spring arrives'.
entry.tran: (用于日期、时间或事件之前)当…到来时

example.ex: Come the election on the 20th of May, we will have to decide...
example.tran: 到5月20日选举的那一天，我们必须作出决定。

example.ex: He's going to be up there again come Sunday.
example.tran: 到星期天他又会上那儿去。

entry.def: If a thought, idea, or memory comes to you, you suddenly think of it or remember it.
entry.tran: 突然被…意识到;突然被…想起

example.ex: He was about to shut the door when an idea came to him...
example.tran: 他正准备关门，突然想到一个主意。

example.ex: Then it came to me that perhaps he did understand.
example.tran: 然后，我突然意识到他可能的确是明白了。

entry.def: If money or property is going to come to you, you are going to inherit or receive it.

example.ex: The fortune will come to you...
example.tran: 这一大笔钱将归你所有。

example.ex: He did have pension money coming to him when the factory shut down.
example.tran: 工厂倒闭的时候，他的确拿到了养老金。

entry.def: If a case comes before a court or tribunal or comes to court, it is presented there so that the court or tribunal can examine it.
entry.tran: (案件)提交…审理，送交…进行处理

example.ex: The membership application came before the Council of Ministers in September...
example.tran: 会员申请书于9月提交部长会议审议。

example.ex: President Cristiani expected the case to come to court within ninety days.
example.tran: 克里斯蒂亚尼总统要求案件在90天内送交法院审理。

entry.def: If something comes to a particular number or amount, it adds up to it.

example.ex: Lunch came to $80.
example.tran: 午餐总共80美元。

entry.def: If someone or something comes from a particular place or thing, that place or thing is their origin, source, or starting point.

example.ex: Nearly half the students come from abroad...
example.tran: 将近一半的学生来自国外。

example.ex: Chocolate comes from the cacao tree...
example.tran: 巧克力出自可可树。

entry.def: Something that comes from something else or comes of it is the result of it.

example.ex: There is a feeling of power that comes from driving fast...
example.tran: 开快车会让人觉得自己有一种主宰之力。

example.ex: Some good might come of all this gloomy business...
example.tran: 生意不景气也未必全是坏事。

entry.def: If someone comes of a particular family or type of family, they are descended from them.

example.ex: She comes of a very good family.
example.tran: 她的家庭出身非常好。

entry.def: If someone or something comes first, next, or last, they are first, next, or last in a series, list, or competition.

example.ex: The two countries have been unable to agree which step should come next...
example.tran: 接下来该走哪一步，这两个国家还未能就此达成一致意见。

example.ex: The alphabet might be more rational if all the vowels came first...
example.tran: 如果把所有的元音列在前面，字母表可能会更为合理一些。

entry.def: If a type of thing comes in a particular range of colours, forms, styles, or sizes, it can have any of those colours, forms, styles, or sizes.
entry.tran: 有，可提供(某种颜色、形状、款式或尺寸)

example.ex: Bikes come in all shapes and sizes...
example.tran: 各种外形和尺寸的自行车都有。

example.ex: The wallpaper comes in black and white only.
example.tran: 这种墙纸只有黑白的。

entry.def: You use come in expressions such as it came as a surprise when indicating a person's reaction to something that happens.
entry.tran: (用于表示对某事的反应)让人…

example.ex: Major's reply came as a complete surprise to the House of Commons...
example.tran: 梅杰的回答让众议院大吃一惊。

example.ex: The arrest has come as a terrible shock.
example.tran: 这次逮捕让人极为震惊。

entry.def: The next subject in a discussion that you come to is the one that you talk about next.

example.ex: Finally in the programme, we come to the news that the American composer and conductor, Leonard Bernstein, has died...
example.tran: 节目的最后，我们来看一则新闻，美国作曲家兼指挥家伦纳德·伯恩斯坦去世。

example.ex: That is another matter altogether. And we shall come to that next.
example.tran: 那完全是另一回事，接下来我们会谈到。

entry.def: People say 'Come' to encourage or comfort someone.

example.ex: 'Come, eat!' the old woman urged.
example.tran: “好了，吃吧！”老太太催促道。

entry.def: To come means to have an orgasm.
Some people say 'Come again?' when they want you to repeat what you have just said.
entry.tran: 再说一遍？你说什么来着？

entry.def: If you say that someone is, for example, as good as they come, or as stupid as they come, you are emphasizing that they are extremely good or extremely stupid.

example.ex: The new finance minister was educated at Oxford and is as traditional as they come.
example.tran: 新财政部长曾就读于牛津大学，是个极为传统的人。

entry.def: People say 'Come, come' to indicate that they disapprove of or disagree with what someone has just said or done.
entry.tran: (表示不赞成或不同意)哦，不，别这样

example.ex: 'You hope for something in Mrs Zuckerman's will?' — 'Come, come, Mr Trethowan. Of course not.'
example.tran: “你希望朱克曼太太在遗嘱里给你留点什么？”“哦，不，特里索恩先生。当然不是。”

entry.def: You can use the expression when it comes down to it or when you come down to it for emphasis, when you are giving a general statement or conclusion.

example.ex: When you come down to it, however, the basic problems of life have not changed...
example.tran: 然而，归根结底，生活中一些基本的问题还是没有变。

example.ex: Few people, when it comes down to it, are so selfless.
example.tran: 说到底，很少有人能这样无私。

entry.def: If you say that someone has it coming to them, you mean that they deserve everything bad that is going to happen to them, because they have done something wrong or are a bad person. If you say that someone got what was coming to them, you mean that they deserved the punishment or bad experience that they have had.

example.ex: He was pleased that Brady was dead because he probably had it coming to him.
example.tran: 他很高兴布雷迪死了，因为他可能纯粹是自找的。

entry.def: You use the expression come to think of it to indicate that you have suddenly realized something, often something obvious.
entry.tran: 突然想起来;突然明白过来

example.ex: He was his distant relative, as was everyone else on the island, come to think of it...
example.tran: 哦，对了，他是他的远亲，岛上的其他人也是。

example.ex: You know, when you come to think of it, this is very odd.
example.tran: 其实你要想一想的话，这还是挺怪的。

entry.def: When you refer to a time or an event to come or one that is still to come, you are referring to a future time or event.
entry.tran: (时间或事件)未来的，接下来的

example.ex: The War will remain a heated topic of debate for some time to come...
example.tran: 这场战争在未来的一段时间内仍将是人们热议的话题。

example.ex: I hope in years to come he will reflect on his decision...
example.tran: 我希望未来的几年里他会反省自己的决定。

entry.def: You can use the expression when it comes to or when it comes down to in order to introduce a new topic or a new aspect of a topic that you are talking about.

example.ex: Most of us know we should cut down on fat. But knowing such things isn't much help when it comes to shopping and eating...
example.tran: 我们大多数人都知道应该减少脂肪的摄入量。但是在购物和吃东西的时候，这些常识就丢到一边去了。

example.ex: However, when it comes down to somebody that they know, they have a different feeling.
example.tran: 然而，涉及他们认识的人，他们的感觉就不同了。

entry.def: You can use expressions like I know where you're coming from or you can see where she's coming from to say that you understand someone's attitude or point of view.
entry.tran: 我明白你的意思/你可以看出她的态度

example.ex: To understand why they are doing it, it is necessary to know where they are coming from...
example.tran: 要弄清楚他们这样做的原因，必须要了解他们的意图。

example.ex: You see where I'm coming from?
example.tran: 你明白我的意思了吗？

means.word_mean: 1. move toward, travel toward something or somebody or approach something or somebody;
2. reach a destination; arrive by movement or progress;

sentences.sentence: "She didn't get to Chicago until after midnight"

means.word_mean: 3. come to pass; arrive, as in due course;

sentences.sentence: "The first success came three days later"

means.word_mean: 4. reach a state, relation, or condition;

sentences.sentence: "We came to understand the true meaning of life"
"I came to realize the true meaning of life"

means.word_mean: 5. to be the product or result;
6. enter or assume a condition, relation, use, or position;

sentences.sentence: "He came into contact with a terrorist group"
"I came to see his point of view"
"These shoes come in three colors; The furniture comes unassembled"
"A scream came from the woman's mouth"
"The water came up to my waist"

means.word_mean: 11. exist or occur in a certain point in a series;
12. come from; be connected by a relationship of blood, for example;

sentences.sentence: "She was descended from an old Italian noble family"

means.word_mean: 14. come under, be classified or included;
16. add up in number or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "This idea will never amount to anything"
"News came in of the massacre in Rwanda"

means.word_mean: 19. come to one's mind; suggest itself;

sentences.sentence: "It occurred to me that we should hire another secretary"
"A great idea then came to her"
"How is she doing in her new job?"
"How are you making out in graduate school?"
"she could not come because she was too upset"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cuman, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch komen and German kommen
